page.title: 07SWIMMING POOL
page.content: Kirkcaldy Swimming Pool was opened in 1971. The leisure centre was added later. The pool is thirty three and a third meters long. At the shallow end it is one meter deep and the diving area is three meters deep. Kirkcaldy pool has one spring board at one meter and two diving boards at three meters and five meters. The pool was originally heated by coal, but was changed to gas in 1983. It takes 220,000 gallons of water to fill it. The average weekly cost of running the complex is Â£6,500. On average about 1,000 people use the pool every week, including various clubs, e.g. scuba diving, canoe, diving and swimming clubs. In the leisure centre there is a sauna suite, a fitness room, four sunbeds and a cafe. Thirty people are employed in the whole complex. Future plans include running a creche.
